entries.title: Platform/Model SDK Environment Setup
entries.description: Complete step-by-step guide to set up SDK development environment

content.overview: The Mendix Platform SDK and Model SDK allow programmatic access to Mendix apps. Use this for automation, bulk changes, documentation generation, CI/CD, and more.

step_2_install_packages.title: Install SDK Packages
step_2_install_packages.explanation: mendixplatformsdk handles connection/authentication, mendixmodelsdk provides the model API

step_3_set_token.title: Set Environment Variable
step_3_set_token.permanent: Add to your shell profile (.bashrc, .zshrc) or Windows Environment Variables

step_4_get_app_id.title: Find Your App ID
instructions: 1. Open your app in Mendix Developer Portal (https://sprintr.home.mendix.com)
3. Copy the App ID (UUID format: xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx)

step_5_create_script.title: Create Your First Script

common_patterns.read_only: Don't call flushChanges() or commitToRepository() - working copy is discarded
common_patterns.load_domain_model: const dm = await domainModel.load(); // Returns entities, associations, etc.

critical_notes: model.allEntities() does NOT exist - use domainModel.load().entities
workingCopy.id is a PROPERTY not a method (no parentheses)
PAT must have 'mx:modelrepository:repo:write' scope for commits

entries.title: Pluggable Widget Development Setup
entries.description: Complete step-by-step guide to create pluggable widgets

content.overview: Pluggable widgets are custom React components that integrate with Mendix apps. They use TypeScript and provide rich configuration options in Studio Pro.

step_1_install_generator.title: Install Mendix Widget Generator
step_1_install_generator.explanation: Yeoman generator creates widget scaffolding with all required files

prompts.author: Your name
prompts.project_path: Path to Mendix project for testing (optional)
prompts.widget_type: For web (recommended) or For native mobile
prompts.widget_template: Empty widget, Full widget, or Chart widget

step_4_development.title: Development Workflow

commands.start: npm start - Builds widget and watches for changes
commands.lint: npm run lint - Check code quality

step_4_development.hot_reload: Widget is rebuilt automatically and copied to your Mendix project's widgets folder

step_5_test_in_studio_pro.title: Test in Studio Pro
steps: 1. Open your Mendix project in Studio Pro
2. Press F4 to synchronize (picks up new widget)
3. Find widget in Toolbox under your category

key_concepts.EditableValue<T>: Two-way binding to entity attributes - use for input widgets
key_concepts.DynamicValue<T>: One-way binding for display - expressions, calculated values
key_concepts.ActionValue: Execute microflows, nanoflows, or other actions
key_concepts.ListValue: Access list of objects from data source
key_concepts.ListAttributeValue<T>: Get attribute values for items in a list
key_concepts.useDebounce: Hook to debounce rapid value changes

entries.title: Studio Pro Extension Development Setup
entries.description: Guide to creating Studio Pro extensions (C# or Web)

content.overview: Studio Pro Extensions let you add custom functionality to the Mendix Studio Pro IDE itself. There are two types: C# extensions (deep integration) and Web extensions (custom editor panes).

csharp_extension.use_for: Menu items, context menus, document analysis, model manipulation
csharp_extension.integration: Deep integration with Studio Pro internals

web_extension.integration: Runs in embedded browser, communicates via API

prerequisites: Visual Studio 2022 or VS Code with C# extension

entries.title: Local MPR Analysis with mx.exe
entries.description: Use mx.exe for offline, local analysis of .mpr files without API calls

content.overview: mx.exe is a command-line tool bundled with Studio Pro that can analyze .mpr files locally without needing API tokens or internet connection. Great for CI/CD, local scripts, and quick analysis.

dump_mpr.description: Export model as JSON for analysis

check.description: Run consistency checks (like F5 in Studio Pro)
